cons: l do not feel upper management truly supports their employees that are in the trenches doing hands on work with patients, especially the home-care employees . Co-visits With a PT no longer have a unit value, for PTAs, even though we have to join a PT to gain patients, Therefore, we have to see more patients to make our weekly quota and are not expected to work overtime. “Do more for less”. Pay does not reflect experience or skills, leaving one to feel under valued.

review_title: If you value your mental health, stay away from Corporate IT
job_title: Senior Systems Engineer in Rochester, NY
pros:
Flexible work environment, 
Since it's a healthcare system, vacation and sick time are generous to start, 
Ability to work from home if that's what you prefer
cons: Upper management believes in the "do more with less" mantra and the less is headcount, unfortunately. Upper management also has no clear direction on IT strategy/technology and when they finally do make a decision, it changes at the drop of a hat, causing frustration and rework. There is no follow-through on promises of promotions, raises, etc. I had an open position on my team for 9+ months that went unfilled (until the req was cancelled) while we repeatedly told management we were extremely busy and needed that extra person. IT folks are mostly competent but some are just biding their time to retirement and don't go out of their way to help, especially if it means extra work for them.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Rochester, NY

cons: I hate to say that I wasn't appreciated there and I had to go on leave for my dying parent and it was used against me even when they knew when I was hired I had a terminally ill parent, they let me go saying that I could come back if I wanted to but every time I apply I get turned down being told that I don't have the qualifications with over thirty years of experience what a total shame. I wouldn't come back to the Portland location but would work for Unity instead. My parent's doctor was furious to learn that I had lost my position due to lack of understanding and poor judgement.

review_title: Poor Management, ill equipt facility to handle aggressive patients
job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Greece, NY
pros: I loved working with patients, we had a lot of freedom to make our own lesson plans. healthcare was nice
cons: There are serious safety concerns. At Unity Hospital Greece Chemical Dependency there's only one body guard, yet we have patients that are aggressive, violent, and dangerous. The nurses don't have the proper psych medications if something goes wrong. The other patients get scared so then patients leave because their care is poor. Their solution is to "get better management" that attend workshops and immediately clock out even if there's a serious violent situation happening becuase its not their problem. The structure needs to be different so nurses and techs (the only people on staff 24/7) can feel safe.

cons: Not enough training, support or resources.

job_title: Adult Day Programs Manager in Rochester, NY
pros: Flexibility of work schedule and decision making
cons: Working with a challenging population

pros: Flexible schedule, good insurance, pension plan.
cons: I don’t have anything to say.

job_title: Clinical Social Worker in Rochester, NY
pros: Family Hospital Friendly Care Services
cons: Staff needs to be compensated better

job_title: Information Systems Technician in Rochester, NY
pros: Semi-flexible schedule and friendly co-workers.
cons: Low pay even with experience

job_title: Health Home Care Manager in Rochester, NY
pros:
They have excellent benefits.
Educational reimbursement
cons: There is no advancement when you are a minority

job_title: PGY1 Pharmacy Resident in Rochester, NY
pros: Lots of good people who are able and willing to help.
cons: Nothing really bad to mention

review_title: Rochester Regional Health is a great hospital to start your health career but not to stay long term.
job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Rochester, NY
pros: The best pros I can give this company is you can make a mistake and you won’t immediately be fired for it. It will be used as a learning experience. The company also works your hours around your life outside of work under certain conditions. There’s always overtime to pick up.
cons: First in foremost you’re overworked and under paid. There’s no such thing as effective and efficient communication with this company. You get burnt out very fast because how many attitudes you have to deal with. Nurses are overwhelmed with how many patients they have so then that is passed down to the Technicians who in which are overworked. If you work overtime and the unit is capped off or they don’t have enough patients they will flex (send you home) or make them use PTO. Last but not least the overtime that you work is not guaranteed to keep if they don’t have enough patients other than that you will lose it because they will send you home early.

pros: Steady employment in health care field
cons: Lots of meetings to attend

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Rochester, NY
pros: lots of areas to choose from
cons: some old time attitudes remain

pros: Flexible, company that cares about you
cons: Lots of hours and not a lot of pay

pros: Large company so there are lots of people around
cons: Large company and you can get lost in the shuffle

pros: Company offers a wide variety of clinical positions
cons: There is a lack of upward mobility.

pros: Everyone helps another out with teamwork
cons: Alot of sickness with patients

review_title: Merger has disgraced Unity Health and their culture
pros: Unfortunately not any.  Sad, Isn't it.
cons: I am a former employee of Rochester Regional Health System and I have to say that does not make me sad for one second. The culture shift that happened after the merger (if you want to call it that) has been disgusting to watch. Unity Health may not have been the best or most highly regarded but we had a family and we treated each other with respect.  Since the acquisition, RGH has taken over and the culture of the organization has suffered.  People are leaving in droves and/or laid off.  No one is happy.  The goal, from a former employees perspective, is to eliminate the unity leadership and take over. Which they are very successful in doing thus far.  It's just sad to watch.  I am hoping patient care is not being affected by  the lack of morale throughout the unity organization.  It's not a fun place to work - and leaders don't seem to care much about your life, background or experience.  It's all about which badge you hold.

review_title: Corporate culture wolf in healthcare sheep's clothing
job_title: Licensed Medical Care Provider in Rochester, NY
pros: My coworkers are wonderful to work with and for the most part my 1st level supervisors are also. Overall good patient care.  Reasonable compensation and benefits considering current economy.
cons: Ex corporate managers (Kodak as example), tend to ruin the environment.  Bonus incentives for management  weighted to much for making budget. High turn over in my department. I'm planning on leaving after 5 years (I'll be vested). One of the most important aspects of the hospital - keeping it clean - fails miserably. At times the staff is stretched dangerously thin. Bad for both staff and patients and staff.  Bad communication and poorly organized.

review_title: Not as satisfied since the merger. Poor increases and benefits taken away that made it beneficial to stay.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Rochester, NY
pros: I love my actual job, my clients, most of my co-workers, volunteers and community supports. I take great pride in my work and feel I make a difference in the way I care for our patients, they  acknowledge my sincerity and general concern for their well being.
cons: Do not feel valued or recognized in any way by anyone in management. Suggestions and concerns seem to fall on deaf ears, acknowledgements of problematic issues is given but no solutions or actions are taken. Structure of management, director, program manager, clinical leader none of them on the same page with allows for no accountability. No one knows what the other is doing.

review_title: Horrible, unbelievably awful place to work.
pros: Can't think of any except I liked my co-workers very much but they were so upset and on edge everyday because of the awful managers they were not themselves.  They are not able to do their jobs properly because they are afraid of being fired for no reason.
cons: The upper management of are simply awful people in every way!  They lie to get what they want in place, they make up stories about employee's that have no truth basis.  They BULLY them on a daily basis and keep them in fear of losing their jobs.  They keep people who don't even show up to work, mis manage the people who do show up and then get rid of the ones the personally "don't like" or is not in line with what they personally want.  I am not only happy to be out of that hell hole - I would not trust or be friends with any of the Executive Team and the Minions!

pros: Management was consistently friendly, approachable, and easy to talk to.
cons: Staff seem generally unhappy.  During my interview, two of the nurses on the unit discussed plans to leave RGH in the immediate term because of low pay.  One commented that she could not afford to take a vacation.  Another nurse was generally apathetic about her position.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Rochester, NY
pros: Pay is not bad most of the staff friendly
cons: They really dont care about helping you get to know the residents . I felt like the orientation was crappy...didn't give me enough time to get to know the residents and wanted me to pick up shifts with out properly or allowing me to finish orientation the head boss talks to her staff disrespectful and there was no team work.

review_title: Overall I think the company has good values, although there should be more unity.
pros: You make more money as a clinical nurse I (once you hit the year mark) than strong or highland and I can't imagine accepting LESS money for the work I do
cons: I don't like my specific unit and am looking to move to another.  There are no unions here and every floor can make its own policies to whatever the manager sees fit within reason.  And if you want to move up you have to do a ridiculous amount of work to make $1-2 more an hour.  Not worth it in my opinopn.

pros: Love the 12 hour shifts & I love my co-workers, a great crew of nurses, patient care techs and secretaries. We really take care of each other!
cons: Floating to other units, on call responsibility and being cancelled for your shift, when cancelled you can take it without pay or use your time, this can deplete your time quickly if you want to be paid for the time.

review_title: A little goes a long way
pros:
- Good leadership staff
- Leading health care facilities
- Ability to help many patients on many different levels
cons:
- A lot of hand holding other staff. No one wants to take responsibility for actions, and some leadership have a very loose definition of correction.
- They are growing very quickly and facing many of the growing pains any organization does, but are lacking communication to middle and lower management staff.
-

review_title: Good Place to Start or End your work life, but not anywhere in the middle
job_title: Facilities Technician General in Newark, NY
pros: Little accountability, Long breaks, Pension
cons: Low Pay, People starting will make as much as you walking though the door, Low moral, Disheartening, No future, More work you do, the more you'll be expected to do

review_title: Clinician of a Behavioral Health Department
pros: Insurance and Benefits are good
cons:
Was a running a theme of mid level management being disconnected from the needs of employees and client population especially those of multi diverse  background.
Clique behavior accepted as the norm, spanning from regular employees to the supposed leaders. If you are not of proper social position, you will know.
Mid level management unable to seriously consider new or suitable ideas.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Rochester, NY
pros: I worked evening shifts for the Assisted Living communities as a front desk receptionist. It was a really easy job, I stayed at a computer and greeted families and guests, and answered questions that the residents had, which were mostly repetitive and simple. Working the evening shift was great because management would leave almost as soon as I arrived. They were all very friendly though, and gave frequent and positive performance reviews to their staff and encouraged them to be their best. I enjoyed it.
cons: Management was shifting as I left, there were new nurse managers coming in who were not very personable.

review_title: Very low pay, especially for what you do
job_title: Patient Care Technician in Rochester, NY
pros:
Good place to get a start in the medical field
Offers student programs for highschoolers
cons:
Very low pay, especially for what you do
Dangerously short staffed in many areas
Not enough raises, and when you do get them, you can't even tell.
Give too many chances for bad employees
Very outdated 
Environmental Services many times takes a long time to come clean an area you call for, or never come at all
Many lazy and unprofessional employees
Inconsistency and favoritism with management leaves other good employees in the dust

job_title: Addiction Therapist Supervisor in Rochester, NY
pros: Flexible, patients are great, decent pay.  Immediate teams are wonderful, fairly isolating from community collaborations.  Many different programs to offer more opportunities for professional development.  Assistance with retirement, accessible to financial planner and legal services.
cons: Merger has been difficult, new administration seems less invested in employee wellness, community.  Health insurance benefits are too limited.  Decreasing frequency of tuition reimbursement.

pros: Co-workers were fun to work with and overall would be kind to each other and patients
cons: Many younger nurses are lazy and treat PCT's like slaves. Bad habits are not addressed and if you constantly call off it is just seen as "your thing" and "I'm not surprised" rather then actually doing something about it. They take advantage of the harder workers and give more freedom to those who don't do what they are suppose to do. The scheduling was horrendous. A worker that had been there for 25 years had stated that he doesn't like working a certain shift and THEY GAVE HIM THAT SHIFT EVERY DAY. Also when someone retired they just scheduled him for 60+ hours, getting a day off every 10 days without clearing it with him. A part time employee that is suppose to only work 20 hours gets scheduled full time without even asking,  just telling after the fact. I was also one of the few with a very inconsistent schedule and overheard a charge nurse talk with the scheduler asking if she cleared certain decisions that were against what the worker would want but she doesn't do anything to change it. The thing that was the worst is that there was a clear separation on who had the scheduling that they wanted. The people in the clique with the scheduler happened to get whatever hours they wanted. When I brought it to the charge nurse's attention I was hounded by the scheduler.

review_title: RGH Medical Groups--Nice place to work, but pay could be better
pros:
1. Some Autonomy as well as some good Team work at times
2. Somewhat flexible schedule
3. Nice Private offices for providers.
4. Awesome charting system and phone / message connectivity
cons:
1. Too many layers of management, that are constantly changing.
2. Authoritarian management style. 
3. Job Security is low

pros: The pay is fair, coworkers are hardworking, friendly, and positive.
cons: Management is disconnected from the group. Expect you to be able to complete a project with no direction, no plan on how, no effort from them, just get it done so they can cross it off their list and look good.

review_title: ACM Laboratory is large off-site lab performing local patient testing and clinical trials. Global lab locations
pros: Closed on Sundays and holidays. Large volume of testing, able to get wide range of experience. On site parking no need to pay. Company is growing and making millions of dollars.
cons: Little room for advancement in Laboratory positions. Health and 401k benefits are mediocre. Not flexible to negotiate salary. Locked into brackets and cannot move outside of those ranges. Profits don’t seem to benefit non-management employees, seems like the health system absorbed the profits instead.

pros: It is a very laid back atmosphere. They're very flexible with scheduling. The food in the cafeteria is very reasonably priced. Very nice people to work with.
cons: We are given far too much work to accomplish in the time allotted. It's impossible to finish everything. No one is kept to task on their duties. We don't have the supplies to do our jobs properly and in a timely manner. Complaints fall on deaf ears.

pros: Great people, a pension plan and good vacation benefits. Very diverse team by IT standards. Many women and people of color, not just white male tech bros.
cons: Surprisingly poor health benefits for a health care system.

pros: This organization is a very positive place to work.  Everyone is supportive, teamwork is encouraged, and no matter where you are, people will always smile and say hello as they walk past.
cons: Because of the cost challenges in Healthcare, funds are tight.  Equipment is used until it's last minutes of life.  Computer replacements are hard to come by, Every penny is stretched as far as it can go.

pros: Great people. They become a family to you. You all grow and it's great as a learning experience. Great medical experience and great way to learn medical field.
cons: The way your treated by Pts. Hard work but not the greatest pay. Long hours and other CAs aren't the best.

pros: I've loved my experience so far working for RRH. I've been with the company for about a year and a half. I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking employment. I have an amazing work/life balance (which is difficult to find nowadays) and I am in a position where I feel supported enough to make my own business decisions.  I look forward to continuing to career with RRH.
cons: Since RRH is a non-profit, salaries could be more compensative.

pros: Working with dedicated coworkers to improve the experience of patients, visitors and staff within a large healthcare system.
cons: Beware of whom you report to and their management style.  Demanding and impossible at times to keep up with workload.  Poor work/life balance.

review_title: Easy entry level into a radiology department
job_title: Radiology Tech Assistant in Rochester, NY
pros: Been in this current department for 3 years and over all here for 11 years as far as work goes each department varies. Job experience depends on management can be very easy or overly stressful. But in my current position its fairly easy to manage working within the confines of what I do. Free parking also a perk here.
cons: Benefits aren't as glamorous as other healthcare companies. High volume of patients can get annoying.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Rochester, NY
pros: Good place to work. pleasant experience working on multiple floors. Most managers offer a flexible schedule allowing you to work full-time and go to school full time with 3 12 hr shifts a week. Great benefits, Paid vacation, Sick days.
cons: Work can be exhausting, management can be tough at times they get a lot of pressure put on them and put it on us in return.

review_title: Ok place to work, unorganized management.
pros: People I get to work with are nice. You get to help people that truly care out helping patients. There seems to be potential for growth.
cons: Health Insurance is expensive for working for a health network. Use of personal cellphone and Internet for work is not being compensated.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Newark, NY
pros: The benefits were great, staffing office was easy to work with and for the most part you were left alone to do you job.
cons: You were left alone to do your job. The management all have “I’m better than you” attitudes and depending what shift you work depends on how many nurses will actually talk to you.

review_title: NEVER will recommend to work here
pros: none to consider in contrast of culture experienced
cons: You will only be seen as value to their gain and NOTHING ELSE

pros: Stable company in the healthcare field. Very laid back atmosphere.
cons: Not a very transparent company. You never hear from upper management regarding current initiatives or focus. Doesn't appear to have much room from growth as lots of hiring is done from the outside.

review_title: Not what it used to be.  Management is COLD as ICE!
job_title: PMO Project Manager in Rochester, NY
pros: Fair vacation and retirement plan
cons: Team cohesion is non existent, management is cold and impersonal, you will never receive a thank you from your direct boss, if they could implant a GPS tracker in your arm they would but for now it's a check in/out procedure on a dry erase board, lack of consistency, good luck to those trying to make it to retirement.  When did people skills go out the window?

job_title: Physician Billing/Patient Account Representative in Irondequoit, NY
pros: No shortage of work. Friendly staff. Flexibility for w/l issues is decent
cons: Understaffed, makes for getting all work complete difficult, but management does not see that

pros: Great experience, excellent team to work with. High level management. Great computer system to learn. With all experience that i had at Rochester Regional Hospital i feel like i can fit at any other hospital or doctor office.
cons: I wish we could talk more with management about office place and breaks between lunch and ending shift.

pros: The co-workers in the department were wonderful to work with.
cons: The Manager needs something to be desired. If you work the 11AM to 7PM shift, you have no life, as 7PM, could turn into 8:00PM or later.

review_title: Business centric rather than patient centric
pros: Different high priority tasks every day, you won't get bored
cons: Management spends their days in meetings, is pretty much clueless as to what it takes to run day to day operations.

pros: Staff treat one another well, but people are not treated well by upper management. I actually can’t think of enough to put here.
cons: Pay for parking, health care benefits are the worst, and they don’t give you enough time to chose during open enrollment

pros: Many opportunities exist in the system for employees including promoting from within and education for professional growth including certification and career ladders
cons: Policies don’t permit employee transfer to other area if not successful in a particular area regardless of past success in another affiliate

pros: Good team members, welcoming environment and fair wages.  Managers are very helpful in helping you meet your goals and advance in your career
cons: There's no benefit to working extra hours and helping in a bind. You end up loosing your extra hours when things get slow.

pros: Great co-worker that worked as a family and communicated well for the greater care of our patients.
cons: A merger with another company that was larger and dominated the system. Communication, compassion and the greater good of the patient became lost.

pros: Great people who willing to collaborate to achieve best possible outcomes & best practices. High expectations support employees with continuing to up their game.
cons: Huge company but this if fine if you are flexible and can leave your ego at the door. Can require long hours.

pros: Good people, great office staff,  loved my job.  Clean and up to date office.
cons: High Stress.  Office turnover very high, therefore most times doing work of 2-3 people.

pros:
- Gives you the tools and resources to succeed in your job

cons: - Large organization so you sometimes need to advocate for yourself

review_title: Management is draining and running off current staff

pros: Initially good salary and production but...

review_title: The words they speak are all the right words, but they are empty in implementation.
pros: Flexible work environment, parking is free

pros: Appears to be somewhat of a "family oriented" atmosphere which focuses on patient care - a good stepping stone for entry level positions.
cons: As stated in previous reviews, advancement is non existent unless you have relationship with management…don't even bother trying!

pros: Colleagues were kind and empathetic, adequate parking for employees, good cafeteria with a variety of food choices at reasonable prices.

review_title: Maybe the most fun and exciting large company corporate experience I have been apart of in my career so far.

pros: Teamwork is supported and encouraged. We are proud to give great patient care! Management is approachable.
